articles.title: Booklover’s paradise: Next Chapter Bookshop celebrates first anniversary in Hollidaysburg
articles.description: HOLLIDAYSBURG — In a fast-paced, technology-driven world, Next Chapter Bookshop co-owner Dani Fry believes that books can keep human connection alive in small towns like Hollidaysburg. “There’s something different about handing someone a book and saying, ‘Hey, I love this book, and it made me think of you,’” she said. Next Chapter celebrated its first […]
articles.content:
“There’s something different about handing someone a book and saying, ‘Hey, I love this book, and it made me think of you,'” she said.
Next Chapter celebrated its first anniversary Dec. 21, marking a year filled with promoting local authors, curating... [4447 chars]

articles.title: Project Recover finds missing service members through underwater missions
articles.description: Project Recover uses underwater drones and DNA technology to locate missing U.S. service members from past conflicts. Former Navy Rear Admiral Tim Gallaudet leads recovery efforts.
articles.content: More than 80,000 service members who went missing in action in previous conflicts are still unaccounted for. However, through research and new technology, the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency estimates the remains of 38,000 fallen veterans could be ... [6701 chars]

articles.title: NBFCs, healthcare, tech drive a record year for India's IPO market
articles.description: India’s IPO market hit record highs in 2025, with healthcare, technology and NBFCs emerging as the top contributors, while mainboard listings dominated fundraising by value.
articles.content: India’s IPO market hit fresh highs in 2025, led by strong fundraising from healthcare, technology and non-banking financial companies. These sectors emerged as the biggest contributors to new listings during the year. The sector-led surge helped push... [3598 chars]

articles.title: All-new Tata Sierra launched at AM TATA Jammu
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Dec 25: All-new Tata Sierra was launched at AM TATA Jammu today, marking the return of one of India’s most iconic SUVs. The launch event was held at AM TATA’s flagship showroom on NH-44 By-Pass Road, Narwal, Jammu, and saw enthusiastic participation from customers, media representatives and automobile lovers. A statement said the new Tata Sierra represents a modern comeback of a legendary nameplate, combining classic design elements with advanced technology, safety and future-ready features. It said […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Dec 25: All-new Tata Sierra was launched at AM TATA Jammu today, marking the return of one of India’s most iconic SUVs.
The launch event was held at AM TATA’s flagship showroom on NH-44 By-Pass Road, Narwal, Jammu, and ... [1917 chars]

articles.title: Russia Delays LNG Expansion Plans as Western Sanctions Bite, Bloomberg Reports - UNITED24 Media
articles.description: Russia postponed plans to significantly increase it liquefied natural gas (LNG) output as Western sanctions continue to disrupt financing and technology
articles.content:
Russia postponed plans to significantly increase it liquefied natural gas (LNG) output as Western sanctions continue to disrupt financing and technology access, Bloomberg reported on December 25.
Russia’s Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak said sa... [1135 chars]

articles.title: Dr Jitendra launches 5 new digital reforms to mark Good Governance Day
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent NEW DELHI, Dec 25: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Earth Sciences, and Minister of State in the PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh, today inaugurated the National Workshop on Good Governance Practices 2025 in Delhi. Addressing senior officers of Govt of India, policymakers and stakeholders on the occasion of Good Governance Day, observed annually on 25th December, the Minister highlighted that good governance is not an abstract […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
NEW DELHI, Dec 25: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Earth Sciences, and Minister of State in the PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh, to... [3758 chars]

articles.title: SKUAST-K unveils 16 climate resilient, high yield crop varieties
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent SRINAGAR, Dec 25: Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology of Kashmir has released 16 new high-yielding, nutrient-dense, and climate-resilient crop varieties. The announcement was made during the 10th meeting of the State Seed Sub Committee held at the Civil Secretariat in Jammu under the chairmanship of Additional Chief Secretary, Agriculture Production Department, Shailendra Kumar. The meeting, attended by Prof Haroon Naik, Director Research SKUAST-K; Prof S K Gupta, Director Research SKUAST-J; Sartaj Ahmad Shah, Director Agriculture Kashmir; […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
SRINAGAR, Dec 25: Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology of Kashmir has released 16 new high-yielding, nutrient-dense, and climate-resilient crop varieties.
The announcement was made during the 10th ... [2343 chars]

articles.title: ₹8.1-cr fraud case targeting IPS officer: 2 accused identified, 25 accounts frozen, say cops
articles.description: The cyber crime police station of Patiala had registered an FIR against unidentified persons under Sections 316(2), 336(3), 340(2), 318(4), 319(2) and 61(2) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), along with Section 66(D) of the Information Technology Act.
articles.content: Senior police officials said the frozen amount was secured before it could be siphoned off. These accounts were identified from the documents provided by Chahal, which showed transactions made by several investors, including himself. “We have managed... [2484 chars]

articles.title: Two-day workshop on Disaster Risk Reduction concludes at IUST
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent AWANTIPORA, Dec 25: The Islamic University of Science and Technology (IUST) conducted a two-day capacity building workshop on “Disaster Risk Reduction in Urban Planning, Development and Monitoring: Building a Disaster-Resilient Jammu and Kashmir.” The workshop was jointly organised by the Department of Architecture, Centre for Disaster Risk Reduction (CDRR), and the Department of Planning and Geomatics, IUST, in collaboration with the Department of Disaster Management, Relief, Rehabilitation and Reconstruction (DMRRR), Government of Jammu and Kashmir. The workshop featured […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
AWANTIPORA, Dec 25: The Islamic University of Science and Technology (IUST) conducted a two-day capacity building workshop on “Disaster Risk Reduction in Urban Planning, Development and Monitoring: Building a Disaster-Resilien... [1555 chars]

articles.title: New virtual fencing laws could promise safer bushfire response by allowing farmers to move stock remotely
articles.description: New technology allowing livestock to be remotely moved via electronic collars has been legalised in SA. Industry says virtual fencing has the potential to save animals and even human lives.
articles.content:
South Australian farmers will soon be able to use virtual fencing to move livestock out of the path of bushfires after the technology was formally legalised in the state last week.
The system, which allows livestock to be moved remotely via electroni... [2153 chars]
